column4: hi all, I'm having trouble changing login window theme... the "login window" option doesn't exist in my "administration" menu, just "login screen"...
what ubuntu version are you using?
if its using the gdm3 - i dont think its very themeable at all.  you can do some minor changes - wallpaper and a few otehr things.
i recall some tricks to run   the gnome settings tools as the gdm user, that let you change the fonts and colors and a few other things.
but its a bit of a hassle
so what needs to be different in my installation in order to see the login window options?

Not sure. I recall running the gnome settings as the gdm user and changeing the colors. and tweaking the default wallpaper.  I think theres some info on doing it on the webupd8 blog site and most likely on the askubuntu.com site. I use 11.10 now. so dont recall much about gdm3 tweaking.
are you saying that 11.10 reverted back to the "login window" settings option under "administration"?
11.10 switched to lightdm - which is not very themeable at all either.  So i suggest not worrying about trying to theme the login screen, other then perhaps to change the wallpaper.
thats one reason i dont re,mer how to tweak gdm3 :)
btw - how was the upgrade to 11.10? buggy? thinking about doing it but worried about it breaking all kinds of java/sdk/juniper/printer/sane/sensors/ati/..... stuff
I always do clean installs. Ive had no issues with 11.10
well that means you configure all your hardware from the start? not sure I'm up for that yet...
whats to configure?  I install my video card drivers.. and thats it..
from a empty hd to a working system.. perhaps 30 min tops..

yes, the system boots fast alright, but I've had a lot of trouble cos I had to have both open&closed java, configuring printer properly, sensors for m/b, apache hosts... lots of stuff unfortunately. I'm pretty sure that backuping my home folder is not gonna be enough
